cleaned_text: Smoothie If you have health conditions, like cancer, HIV, AIDS or malnutrition it may be important for you to consume a higher calorie diet to support your immune system and overall health. Smoothies can be a great way to get high-quality, nutritionally dense, calories into your body. The bananas and peanut butter in this smoothie are great sources of magnesium, which is great for patients undergoing chemotherapy who often experience decreased magnesium levels. Bananas are also rich in potassium which is a crucial mineral for blood pressure control. Meanwhile, peanut butter provides vitamin B3 and healthy fat that can lower the risk of heart disease. Ingredients - 1 banana, sliced - 1½ tablespoons peanut butter - 1 ounce soy protein powder - 1 cup milk Instructions - Add milk, banana, peanut butter and protein powder to your blender - Add a small amount of water or a few ice cubes and blend until the smoothie reaches your desired consistency.
